title: w00t
content:
Searching through old files on my computer, I stumbled along a file of things labeled KEEN. I was excited to find Keen1 in the folders, and immediatley played it. And I'm horrible at it. =P

I also found something called Keen 2000, which was a horrible Click-and-Play game that used Keen4 graphics.

But yay, I now have the first Keen game ever.[hr][img]http://img53.imageshack.us/img53/6843/cksighu8.png[/img]Swim
Swim
Hungry

title: Re: w00t
content:
Excellent to hear. Keen 1 is a great game.

Though you could've just downloaded it from the [url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumtheoriginalcommanderkeenga.showMessage?topicID=591.topic]Keen Official Games Thread[/url]. In fact, I recommend doing so, as you'll be assured the most recent version 1.31 and a clean directory that way.

title: Re: w00t
content:
Yeah, it's perhaps my favourite of them. Try some mods too, later. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

Also, I think Keen 2000 was the first Keen fan stuff I found, for some reason. And for some reason I even tried it, back then I had no (bad) expectations of fan games. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
CK2000 wasn't a bad game. It brought back memories to my dad. The songs, that is.

title: Re: .
content:

Even though I am an ordinary man.

title: Re: .
content:
I wonder why in the hell you like it. It's just another 16-bit Windows-based game.

No, better, it's just another Prefabricated game.------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.

title: Prefab.
content:
Being the first Keen fangame many people have played, and possibly among their first online Keen experiences, it would probably have a significant meaning to those people. I may be one of them--I've not played it for years, and it was among the first Keen things I found on the Interweb. I must play it again to find out.

Besides that, prefab games in general tend to have an intriguing atmosphere to them.

title: Re: Prefab.
content:
The clash of non-consistency. It's beautiful.--------------------
